metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6905 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The read_image_tga function in gd_tga.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted TGA image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.3
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2  The commits to fix this issue were included in usn-3060-1 as part of the CVE-2016-6132 fix.

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.3').
